Description: Papyrus written with black ink, demotic legal document dated to month of Mekheir of year 6 of Alexander IV with 4 witness copies. Three people (Kollouthes son of Pakhas, Taesis and Sentaes daughters of Horos) cede house at Thebes to Nitokris daughter of Neshor. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "imperfect at the right side; probably 3 feet missing. verso pasted down. Writing in 3 or more lines to each copy of the contract. There are 5 copies (A-E) of which A and B are incomplete, D & F [sic; lege C-E] are complete".
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.64-6, pl.1, 51-3)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43826) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43826)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: cockled, delaminating, lifting Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Frame: wood Object Priority: C Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: C
